newsitem.title: USA: S. Carolina Senate approves $250 million bonds.
newsitem.headline: S. Carolina Senate approves $250 million bonds.

text.p: The South Carolina Senate has approved $250 million of general obligation bond issues, mostly for universities and prisons, legislative officials said.
The bond bill had already passed in the House and won approval in the Senate on Tuesday with little debate.
It included $51.4 million of GO bonds for prison construction and $150 million for construction and maintenace projects at public colleges, universities and technical schools.

It also contained $17 million for agricultural programs at Clemson University, $10 million to buy and preserve the Jocasse Gorges forest tract, and $3 million for airport improvements sought by the ste Commerce Department.
